definition: Yokosuka (port and navy base in the Tokyo bay)

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
Yokosuka city and US naval base to the west of Yokohama, Japan

sentences.english: He is now on the Yokosuka Navy Base with his family.
sentences.chinese: 他現在和他的家人一起待在美軍的橫須賀海軍基地裏。

sentences.english: Yoshi Ikeda, 34, works at the US Navy Base pool in Yokosuka, Japan.
sentences.chinese: 34歲，在駐日美軍在橫須賀的海軍基地裏任職。

sentences.english: The 7th Fleet is the United States Navy's permanent forward projection force based in Yokosuka in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美國海軍第七艦隊司令部駐紮在日本橫須賀。

definition: Horse-Face, one of the two guardians of the underworld in Chinese mythology

marginalized people (not part of mainstream society)/marginal man (term coined by social psychologist Kurt Lewin, referring to a person in transition between two cultures or social groups, not fully belonging to either)
Pokémon or Pocket Monsters, popular Japanese video game, anime and manga
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
lit. reincarnated in sb else's body (idiom); fig. a discarded or discredited idea returns in another guise
Okayama prefecture in southwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
